revised_title: Postsynaptic Calcium Entry Induced by Transmitter Action
tldr: The authors investigated the entry of calcium ions into the postsynaptic axon of a squid during synaptic activity using the photoprotein aequorin. They found that synaptic activity led to an influx of calcium ions, which could be detected by the light emitted by aequorin. This allowed them to estimate the amount of calcium entering the postsynaptic axon and study its relationship with membrane polarization and the effect of various agents on the synaptic light.
